item.title: How the Python Packaging community is organised
item.description: The way the Python packaging community is organised is something that I’ve explained in multiple places, in multiple contexts. I figure that it’ll be useful to actually write it down in a single place, so that I don’t have to repeat myself. The Python Packaging Authority The Python Packaging Authority (PyPA) is a fairly loose group of projects that happen to be related to Python packaging. While the PyPA has a formal governance model, there’s no “oversight” or “enforcement” on projects that are part of the PyPA – they are only required to adopt the PSF Code of Conduct and to be accepted by the existing members.
